rationale: This proposal aims to accumulate USDT for Fellowship salaries through DCA orders, swapping DOT for USDT via HydraDX Omnipool.
details: We support this initiative for diversifying the Treasury, benefiting Fellowship salaries, the DOT token, and ecosystem efficiency.

proposal: #219 - BlockchainBrad Educational & Journalist Content - 6 Months funding
rationale: This proposal aims to fund 6 month of work on 180 YouTube videos, offering long and short content.
details: Brad is a crypto pioneer, focused on Polkadot's tech and parachain teams dev. We support his return and his proposal with our AYE.

rationale: This proposal aims to fund Hackathon in Hong Kong.
details: The amount of 90k DOT, which equals to 368k USD, is quite high, even considering the impact of the Hackathon. We voted NAY on this.

proposal: #157 - Increase DOT media visibility through media buying and airdrop campaign
rationale: This proposal aims to airdrop DOT tokens and create content to attract new users into the ecosystem.
details: The amount of 235k DOT, which equals to 1 milion USD, is hugely overshot. And doing airdrop by using KYC to users is not the best idea to get adoption.

proposal: #247 - Tip for N4DRO for his forensic analysis of addresses associated with recent voting behavior
rationale: This referendum aims to tip 5 KSM to N4DRO for swift on-chain analysis.
details: Tipping N4DRO for swiftly analyzing addresses involved in Kusama referenda could help to safeguard network security. That's why we voted AYE.

rationale: By that referendum approved, HydraDX will add GLMR to the Omnipool.
details: Having GLMR in the Omnipool will boost the usage of it, which will benefit both HydraDX and Moonbeam.
